Detailed Description

Displays a button with an image (instead of text) that can be pressed or clicked by the user.

By default, an ImageButton looks like a regular Button, with the standard button background that changes color during different button states. The image on the surface of the button is defined either by the gaia:src attribute in the XML element or by the setImageResource(int) method.

To remove the standard button background image, define your own background image or set the background color to be transparent.

 // Set image button click event
 #include <gaia/core/event/OnClickListener.h>
 class MyOnClickListener : public gaia::core::OnClickListener 
 {
     public:
         MyOnClickListener(gaia::core::Page* page) {};
         ~MyOnClickListener() {};
         virtual void onClick(gaia::core::Widget* v) {};
 };
 MyOnClickListener listener(static_cast<Page*>(this));
 ImageButton* ib = new ImageButton(static_cast<Page*>(this));
 ib->setOnClickListener(&listener);

 ImageButton* ib = new ImageButton(static_cast<Page*>(this));
 // set button icon from reource
 ib->setImageResource(R::drawable::image1);
